com.inamik.template
Class Template

extends java.lang.Object

Template - Represents a compiled template.

Dave

Method Detail

addVariable

public void addVariable(java.lang.String name,
                        TemplateVariable value)
addVariable w/String, TemplateVariable - Adds a variable that can be accessed by the template during process().

As a convenience, Template remembers variables that have been set and will automatically re-add them to the context in each call to process().

NOTE: Remember to call reset() to reset the context before each subsequent call to process()

Parameters:
name - The name of the variable.
value - The variable to add
See Also:
process(), reset(), TemplateVariable

addVariable

public void addVariable(java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.Object value)
addVariable w/String, Object - Adds a variable that can be accessed by the template during process().

This is a convenience method for adding variables without have to deal with TemplateVariable.newInstance(). It is eqvuivelent to the following:

addVariable(name, TemplateVariable.newInstance(value));

As a convenience, Template remembers variables that have been set and will automatically re-add them to the context in each call to process().

NOTE: Remember to call reset() to reset the context before each subsequent call to process()

Parameters:
name - The name of the variable.
value - The variable to add
See Also:
process(), reset(), TemplateVariable

addMacro

public void addMacro(java.lang.String name,
                     TemplateMacro macro)
addMacro - Adds a macro that can be accessed by the template during process().

As a convenience, Template remembers macros that have been set and will automatically re-add them to the context in each call to process().

NOTE: Remember to call reset() to reset the context before each subsequent call to process()

Parameters:
name - The name of the macro.
macro - The macro to add
See Also:
process(), reset(), TemplateMacro

setOut

public void setOut(java.io.PrintWriter out)
setOut w/PrintWriter - Sets the PrintWriter that should receive the output from the processed template.

If no PrintWriter is set before the call to process(), then the Template will default to System.out.

Parameters:
out - The PrintWriter that should receive the output from the processed template.
See Also:
PrintWriter, System.out

setOut

public void setOut(java.io.PrintStream out)
setOut w/PrintStream - Sets the PrintStream that should receive the output from the processed template.

This is a convenience method for setting the output to a PrintStream and is equivelent to the following:

setOut(new PrintWriter(out))

Parameters:
out - The PrintStream that should receive the output from the processed template.
See Also:
setOut(PrintWriter), PrintStream

reset

public void reset()
reset - Reset the context. If you want to process a template multiple times, you should call reset() between calls to process().

You do not need to call reset() before your FIRST call to process().

You do not have to re-add any variables or macros defined with addVariable() or addMacro(). They will be re-added to the context during process()

See Also:
addVariable(String, TemplateVariable), addMacro(String, TemplateMacro)

process

public void process()
             throws TemplateException
process - Process the template. Any defined variables or macros are added to the context and output is sent to the specified PrintWriter, or System.out if one is not defined.

Throws:
TemplateException
